result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Trevor Leyde re: asking to have cases expunged, formally discharged from his agent.

02:43 PM  Defendant Trever Lee Leyde in Court pro se.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 15CF216 & 18CF161.  Court notes off-record discussion.  Atty. Larimore and ADA Walker spoke, Probation being extended and DA willing to extend DJOC.  ADA Walker states position; Probation extended in 18CF161 until March of next year, DA willing to extend DJOC.  State recinds Motions to Revoke and will run DJOC parallel w/Probation.  Court states Orders to Extend Probation signed and Orders to Revoke denied.  Adjourned at 2:46 PM
Order to Extend was signed (Order to Revoke to Deferred Judgment of Conviction)
Motion hearing on February 4, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

02:36 PM Defendant Trever Lee Leyde in Court, in custody.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Tricia Rouleau. present.  Includes Motion Hearing on 15CF216 and Probation Review Hearing on 18CF161. Court confirms with Agent Rouleau that she is requesting 45 day sanction.  Court questions if Defendant wishes to obtain counsel.  Agent advises that Defendant has been in custody since 09/25.  ADA Walker willing to continue Motion Hearing to see how Defendant does once released and to allow him time to obtain counsel.  Court will continue hearing to February or March.  Court imposes 45 days conditional time in PCJ commencing 09/25.  Release date is  November 8.  Adjourned at 2:47 PM
Motion hearing on October 2, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3 years

4:15Defendant Trever Lee Leyde in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.14CM253, 15CM155,15CM178 and 15CT103 heard at this time. OSullivan: guilty #1 in 15CF216, Ct#1,2 in 15CM155, Ct#1,2 in 15CM178, and CT#1 in 15CT103. PBT .084 15CM155,15CM178,15CT103 3years probation; concurrent. court costs, 30 days jail, restitution $1184.67 in 15cM155, comply with court order in Hennepin County Family Case. No contact with minor son unless it's supervised by Christina Webster's mother and no contact with Christina Webster. guilty to 15CF216 with a DPA to offer. All other counts would be dismissed. 14CM253 will be dismissed. Atty Larimore and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas no contest to Ct#1 in 15CF216 and states the factual basis is enough that he would be found guilty at trial, Ct#1,2 in 15CM155, Ct#1,2 in 15CM178 and Ct#1 in 15CT103; Larimore stipulates to a factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds Def guilty of Ct#1 in 15CF216 and will withhold adjudication of JOC. Court finds and adjudicates guilty to: Ct#1,2 in 15CM155, Ct#1,2 in 15CM178 and Ct#1 in 15CT103. Court dismisses 14CM253 and Ct#2 in 15CF216, Ct#3,4 in 15CM178 and Ct#2 15CT103. OSullivan and Larimore address sentencing. Larimore argues for a short jail sentence. Victim addresses the court. Defendant addresses the court.  Court approves the DPA and signs in 15CF216. Court: S/W 3 years probation: Ct#1,2 in 15CM155 and 15CM178 and Ct#1 in 15CT103; each concurrent. conditions on 15CM155 and 15CM178: 30 days jail; concurrent to 15CT103; stayed until...........................,  court costs and DNA surcharge. Agent to look at cognitive therapy and an assessment for batters and batters' treatment and any other therapy or treatment that would be appropriate for his needs. no contact with Kristina Webster or child unless it's supervised by her mother on Monday mornings unless there is a change in the family court order in Hennepin County Minnesota. restitution in 15CM155 $1184.67.
15CT103: 15 days jail ordered and all but 5 days stayed, pending successful completion of probation. $1492.00 fine, AODA and driver safety plan. 12 months revocation of DL. credit for any administrative suspension.  IID for a period of 1 yrs to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.  IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY. $50 IID surcharge. OSullivan states his office will file amended complaints to reflect only the counts guilty to, so Def may apply for expungement. Court will grant expungement upon successful complete of probation on 15CM155 and 15CM178. No expungement on 15CT103.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Christopher Stuart is sworn and examined by O'Sullivan. Witness IDs Defendant. Larimore x-exams Stuart.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
